Description: Fragment of lid of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior, from centre: band of tongues between black lines; black-figure frieze consisting of lions to right (of first head remaining, of second tail and mane); incised circles as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was lost in WWII.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 320, no. 1426, pl. 185, no. 1426)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2085) (phase 2)
